tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW
@RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Have just written to Planning Enforcement Herefordshire CC as I hope many others will do. What is the point of an SSSI if no one enforces it?

We‚Äôve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox

@TheMichaelMoran @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency It‚Äôs hard to see what the purpose of this could be. It‚Äôs terribly tragic and has a feeling of vandalism about it. Could someone be so misinformed to think this was ok? Must have taken huge amount of labour to achieve too.
Is this not breaking the rules @NorfolkschFA @EnvAgency @DHSCgovuk @greatyarmouthbc https://t.co/PyD8RB7Snw

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil You and your partner agencies have a tough job Dave under the current political regime.  Fight the good fight better days will come. Rember you back at Sapphire new to the EA Pete Whalley

Expecting to hear a lot more from @EnvAgency about this bit. A lot more. Seems like most of the damage to the Lugg could have been prevented if EA had Actually. Done. Anything. when the initial report was made, rather than 8 days later.

https://t.co/TFpElReUQZ https://t.co/C90bL64rRM

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal
@NorfolkNChanc11 @NorfolkschFA @EnvAgency @DHSCgovuk @greatyarmouthbc Why have you tagged Norfolk Schools in this ffs ü§£ü§£ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
Our piece by @GlassJet on the depressing news of the destruction of a stretch of Herefordshire's River Lugg  @EnvAgency @WildlifeTrusts  https://t.co/CaNN4WVP5J

#Flooding affects millions worldwide and we need more engineers. 

Join us, @EnvAgency and @learnliveuk on Friday 11 Dec 10am BST to hear what it‚Äôs like to study a sponsored degree in Flood and Coastal Engineering and ask questions.  

Register here: https://t.co/UX0iukfGVl https://t.co/vpzVM1zxJy

Curiouser and curiouser.

The redoubtable @bettwsresident CEO of @WUFoundation making it very clear  that @EnvAgencyMids were alerted to the destruction that was taking place on the River Lugg last week. 

Did EA the respond? If not why not.

Starts 8:37

https://t.co/XbNCDTpqIL

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Good.

If someone vandalised a building like this the enforcement would be severe. And buildings can be fixed much more easily.

Thank you to all the @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm staff out on site working together to take action on reported damage at the #RiverLugg. Stop notices served and an investigation underway. https://t.co/moayq4k5aR

"Be in no doubt that anything less than a prosecution and full restoration of the river, paid for by the perpetrator, will be acceptable‚Äù.

@EnvAgency and others want to prove they are fit for the 21st century? Here's your chance. https://t.co/ji0wmcYyhf

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Well done - EA Drone operator surveying damage at River Lugg at Kingsland site this afternoon - picture editors more at Alamy Live News @guardian @guardianphotos #riverlugg @TelegraphPics https://t.co/SBFVor1VIu
@ianrobertgilmo1 @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Apparently not!
We're taking reports of environmental damage to the #SSSI at the #RiverLugg very seriously, and are working with @EnvAgency and @ForestryComm to take immediate action. https://t.co/27DINp3vD7
@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Why did it take so long for you to take action? I understand the Environment Agency was alerted to the situation some days previously.

@iojikLeigh @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Why can‚Äôt you take away land? Its just an asset at the end of the day. Govt does forced land seizure all the time for infrastructure projects. Also plenty of precedence during war time for the ‚Äògreater good‚Äô.

So the river outside is in full flood - no one in the @EnvAgency Incident room at Brampton - all WFH. They are suggesting we ask ‚Äúsomeone local‚Äù for a view on when it will peak. Well you don‚Äôt get more local than 4ft away. https://t.co/J5GqdhcakY

tweets.text: @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Surely there is a ‚Äúcode of practice‚Äù that covers all groundwork‚Äôs along river banks that contractors must follow?

@EnvAgency @RosieP4 @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm It's happening up & down the country - not just here. Nature, trees, wildlife, greenbelt, green spaces etc. are being destroyed at an alarming rate. Development & economy are king - HS2 as 1 example & billions¬£¬£¬£'s of planned roads another + #BuildBuildBuild on greenfield land.

Exciting update! Salmon redds now spotted in this restored channel (previously none). üêü Plus woody debris slowing the flow after storms and  creating wonderfully complex habitats throughout the floodplain. 
Thanks again to @EnvAgencyNW @NTWestLakes Gosforth Anglers https://t.co/egBQabE4ne

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil They should be made to accept beavers on their land with large scale tree planting - won‚Äôt take a couple of beavers long to sort out the devastation & provide numerous habitats for other wildlife. #beavers
@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Great work. This is diabolical
@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Can you confirm exactly when the @EnvAgency were informed about this incident?

@sciencebase @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Don't know that site, but sounds like standard meadow cutting practise -cut&remove vegetation at end of summer so the nutrients are removed. If you don't, grass outcompetes the other plants and you loose the nectar rich plants&associated insects. It's how meadows were created!

Day 4 of reducing plastic at Christmas - Give reusable gifts such as a reusable coffee cup, soap container or water bottle! üéÅ Did you know that 50% of all plastic produced is used for single-use products? üò¨ @EnvAgency https://t.co/7PKPpsUEx7

tweets.text: @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm While you're at it can you explain why you mow all the wildflowers and their insect life off the Cottenham Lode every August instead of letting it bed down naturally?
